title: GOP Fails to Find a Sober Populism in Pennsylvania
sub_head: The party has a winning political formula. It needs a leader who seems reasonable.
body:
Republican voters in Pennsylvania on Tuesday face a choice not between the pre- and post-Trump GOP or between competing ideological visions in an age of rapidly advancing political opportunity for conservatives. Yet it is still an important choice.
In the state that Mitt Romney, John McCain and George W. Bush all easily won in presidential primaries, thereâ€™s no serious candidate for U.S. Senate offering to return the party to what now seems like the anachronistic consensus those three nominees represented.
